brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and the acceptability of low-residue
      diet package (Enimaclin®) as diet control before colonoscopy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Acceptability of Low-Residue Diet Package (Enimaclin®) as Diet Control Before Colonoscopy

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

outcome.description: Ottawa preparation scale: Colon is defined into 3 segments: Right(cecum, ascending), mid(transverse, descending), rectosigmoid. Each is scored from 0 to 4, 0 is best and 4 is worst. Fluid quantity of whole is scored as 0, small; 1, moderate; 2 large amount. The scale will be summation of the clearness of 3 segments of colon and overall fluid quantity. It ranged from 0 to 14, 0 is the most clean colon and 14 is the most dirty one. Segment score will be analyzed separately as continuous variable.

event.description: Mild abdominal pain noted after bowel preparation.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this study, we investigate a randomized, single-blinded, comparative study to evaluate
      the efficacy and the acceptability of low-residue diet package (Enimaclin®) as diet control
      before colonoscopy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male or female

          -  Outpatient or healthy volunteer for health examination, 20~75 years old

          -  Eligible for oral bowel preparation

          -  BMI (Body Mass Index) ≤ 30

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with severe constipation (as fewer than three stools per week)

          -  Patients with bowel obstruction

          -  Patients contraindicated with treatment drug

          -  Patients who need emergency medication

          -  Ineligible for bowel preparation

          -  Pregnant or breast-feeding

          -  Patients with known allergies to treatment drug or low-residue diet package

          -  Patients who are ineligible to enroll

intervention.description:
Enimaclin Colomil ® (Glico Co., Japan Osaka)，a low-residue diet package for each meal.
The duration of study is one day before colonoscopy.

facility.name: National Taiwan University Hospital Bei-Hu Branch

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Single-blinded, Comparative Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and the Acceptability of Low-residue Diet Package (Enimaclin®) as Diet Control Before Colonoscopy

primary_outcome.description: Ottawa preparation scale: Colon is defined into 3 segments: Right(cecum, ascending), mid(transverse, descending), rectosigmoid. Each is scored from 0 to 4, 0 is best and 4 is worst. Fluid quantity of whole is scored as 0, small; 1, moderate; 2 large amount. The scale will be summation of the clearness of 3 segments of colon and overall fluid quantity. It ranged from 0 to 14, 0 is the most clean colon and 14 is the most dirty one. Segment score will be analyzed separately as continuous variable.
primary_outcome.measure: Overall Cleansing Level at Colonoscopy by Ottawa Bowel Preparation Scale
